meanings.definition: The quality or state of being prepared to do something
meanings.sent1: Her willingness to help others is truly admirable.
meanings.sent2: His willingness to learn new things makes him a great student.
meanings.sent3: The cat showed willingness to chase the laser pointer around the room.
meanings.sent4: The tree's willingness to bend in the wind saved it from breaking.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter's willingness to risk his life to save others is heroic.

meanings.definition: The act of being inclined or ready to do something
meanings.sent1: Their willingness to participate in the project was evident from the start.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate your willingness to listen to my concerns.
meanings.sent3: The robot's willingness to follow commands without question was both impressive and slightly concerning.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's willingness to push through pain led to a record-breaking performance.
meanings.sent5: The student's willingness to ask questions helped clarify the topic for everyone in the class.
